author: italian26
title: Great location good value friendly staff
text:
We stayed just for two nights
Was some problems with TV which unfortunately technician couldn't fix. The operation manager Ms Delphin (sorry if misspelled) and Manager Mr La Ru were very efficient and moved us to an upgraded room.
Seems was a cable tv problem.
The Marriot App which I used to check in did not notify the hotel system .
Executive lounge small with no snacks or fruit in non peak hours but drinks only. Marriot Rive Gauche is nicer larger more variety plus free magazines newspapers.
Breakfast brunch near lobby was as usual good quality.
Beds as usual very comfortable as well as the shower.
Although the hotel has some problems compared to other Marriot or Renaissance in Paris (Rive Gauche or Arc de Triomphe) especially as it much older the location is fantastic and the managers and staff friendly and efficient.
Beware when buying tickets for Louis Vuitton Foundation - the concierge did not inform us when selling us tickets for 25â‚¬ (5 euros more then at the location) that there was no exhibition taking place that week!! The tickets are worth extra cost only if exhibition as you save time lining up . During non exhibition times no lines and there is only tour of the building (for that tour no line and ticket is 1/2 price at the location)
